sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"注意"之意。
means: notice ： 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。
mind ： 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
attend ： 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark ： 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。

sentence.Network_en: I didn't mean any offence. It was a flippant, off-the-cuff remark.
sentence.Network_cn: 我本无意冒犯，那不过是句脱口而出的冒失话。

sentence.Network_en: One of the apprentices made an insulting remark to a passing officer.
sentence.Network_cn: 其中一名学徒对着一名路过的警官说了一句侮辱他的话。

sentence.Network_en: I feel the remark was inappropriate for such a serious issue.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为对如此严肃的问题来说，该评论不合时宜。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in sense 2): from French remarquer 'note again', from re- (expressing intensive force) + marquer 'to mark, note'

entry.def: If you remark that something is the case, you say that it is the case.

example.ex: I remarked that I would go shopping that afternoon...
example.tran: 我说过我那天下午要去购物。

example.ex: 'Some people have more money than sense,' Winston had remarked...
example.tran: “某些人钱多但无头脑，”温斯顿曾经评论道。

entry.def: If you make a remark about something, you say something about it.

example.ex: She has made outspoken remarks about the legalisation of cannabis in Britain...
example.tran: 她对英国关于大麻的立法进行了大胆评论。

example.ex: Geoff Cooke's recent remark that no one is indispensable will certainly not have escaped him.
example.tran: 杰夫·库克近来关于没有什么人是不可缺少的那番话当然也包括他。

means.word_mean: 1. a statement that expresses a personal opinion or belief;

sentences.sentence: "from time to time she contributed a personal comment on his account"
"She observed that his presentation took up too much time"
"They noted that it was a fine day to go sailing"

means.word_mean: 2. make or write a comment on;

sentences.sentence: "he commented the paper of his colleague"

list.explanation: 涉有重要含义的言词、意见或暗示

example.en: In spite of your numerous loaded remarks, I do hope you will return sometime when it is convenient.
example.zh: 尽管你提了不少含蓄的意见，我还是希望你能在方便的时候回来。

auth_sentence.content: President Musharraf says it was a very rude remark.
auth_sentence.res_content: President Musharraf says it was a very rude remark.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: President Musharraf says it was a very rude remark.

auth_sentence.content: How brave of you, they'd frequently remark.
auth_sentence.res_content: How brave of you, they'd frequently remark.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How brave of you, they'd frequently remark.

auth_sentence.content: The remark has no meaning in my own case.
auth_sentence.res_content: The remark has no meaning in my own case.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The remark has no meaning in my own case.

Sentence.sentence: What does Sam Boakye's remark mean?
"Make your own way"," Stand on your own two feet" or my mother's favorite remark when I was face-to-face with consequences of some action: Now that you've made your bed, lie on it.
A student writes what he thinks is an excellent composition, but the teacher writes no encouraging remarks.

The novelist Edward St Aubyn has a narrator remark of the very rich that, "not having to consider affordability, their desires rambled on like unstoppable bores, relentless (持续不断的) and whimsical（反复无常的）at the same time.
He also famously remarked that all of man's problems come from his inability to sit quietly in a room alone.

means.word_mean: 话语, 评论, 谈论, 言辞

sentences.en: In the light of his remarks, we rejected her offer.
sentences.cn: 鉴于他的评语, 我们拒绝了她的提议。

means.word_mean: 谈论, 评论, 议论, 说, 谈到

sentences.en: Mrs. Morse remarked that she seemed a very nice girl.
sentences.cn: 莫斯太太评论说她像是个好女孩。

jushi.english: I remarked the political tension as soon as I entered that country.
jushi.chinese: 我一进入那个国家就注意到紧张的政治局势。

jushi.english: The guide told us to remark the many trees that grew along the forest trail.
jushi.chinese: 向导要我们注意观察生长在森林小道旁的许多树木。

jushi.english: The teacher asked the class to remark the author's style of writing.
jushi.chinese: 老师要求学生们注意作者的写作风格。
